title: Create a deployment and namespace for UD/UCMDB
content:
You can use the tool provided by OMT to create a deployment, which gets a namespace, default certificate, and service account prepared for installing an application by Helm charts.

  1. Log on to the first control plane as a root user. If you want to install OMT as a sudo user, follow the instructions in "Configure sudo access" to give the user-related installation permissions first and then perform the following steps.
  2. Run the following commands to create an ITOM application deployment. 
    cd $CDF_HOME/bin
cdfctl deployment create -d <UD/UCMDB DEPLOYMENT NAME> [-n <UD/UCMDB NAMESPACE>]

    For example: 

    cd $CDF_HOME/bin
cdfctl deployment create -d ucmdb-prod

    The -n option is optional. If you do not specify this option, the value defaults to the deployment name (the value of the -d option). You can run the ./cdfctl.sh deployment -h command to view other options.

    When the application deployment is successful, "Successfully created deployment <name>" is printed to the console.
